settings.title: ONZE DUURZAME AANPAK
settings.content:
We leven in een consumptiemaatschappij. In Europa alleen al wordt er jaarlijks bijna 5 miljard kilo kleding weggegooid. Het grootste gedeelte hiervan is maar kort gedragen, gestimuleerd door trends uit de kledingindustrie. Dit is schadelijk voor mens en milieu. De modeartikelen belanden op grote vuilnisbelten of in zee. Goedkope producten worden bijna altijd onder slechte omstandigheden geproduceerd, om de prijs laag te houden. 

We weten zeker dat dit anders kan. Daarom maken we in ons productieproces zoveel mogelijk gebruik van natuurlijke bronnen en hergebruikte materialen. De leren tassen van Pylos59 hebben een tijdloos ontwerp. Wanneer een duurzaam product langer meegaat, levert dit dubbele winst op. Voor de makers, omdat zij iets waardevols en duurzaams maken. En voor het milieu, omdat het minder belast wordt.

settings.title: ONZE DUURZAME AANPAK
What you see is what you get
GOALS
settings.content: We strive to develop further and to work inspired in this way and to continue to dedicate ourselves to the people around us. We will keep you informed of all the changes we make to give more attention to our fellow humans and the environment through our newsletter!

Our bags are sustainably produced by SA8000 certified factories. This is the highest possible certification for a factory at the moment. Manufacturers that want to achieve and maintain this certification must go beyond just meeting the standard. SA8000 is based on the principles of international human rights. It measures the performance of companies in eight areas that are important for social responsibility in the workplace, as follows: child labour, forced labour, health and safety, free association and collective bargaining, discrimination, disciplinary practices, working hours and compensation. Certification inspection is performed by the internationally accredited Veritas and Société Générale de Surveillance [SGS].

The leather of our bags comes from high-quality tanneries which are certified by LWG with, among others, Silver Label. The Leather Working Group (LWG) is an international, non-profit organization responsible for the world's leading sustainability certification for the leather industry. This choice has several advantages for man and environment, including the reduction of water consumption and the use of water purifiers. In addition, the use and storage of tanning agents and dyes is subject to strict rules. An additional requirement is that tanneries must have a certificate for socially responsible business practices, such as the SA 8000 certification. We consider it a success that we buy LWG-certified leather and use it as a sustainable material for our bags. But our sustainable mission does not stop there. The future holds challenges for us to keep improving at every opportunity.

In addition to the Indian legal standards, BSCI and SA8000 are internationally recognized standards with SA8000 being the most stringent certification worldwide. Our factories must comply with this SA8000 standard, and are rigorously checked to maintain it.
